snippet: An overreliance on anecdotal openings can make our prose feel shopworn rather than vivid. This is particularly true when readers encounter strangers at the top of two or more adjacent stories, whether in print or online. Here are a few recent examples.
abstract: An overreliance on anecdotal openings can make our prose feel shopworn rather than vivid. This is particularly true when readers encounter strangers at the top of two or more adjacent stories, whether in print or online. Here are a few recent examples.

headline.main: Here’s Someone You Never Heard of. Read On.
